block.p: Dr. Joanne Clare Baker, a daughter of Susan and Peter H. Baker of Brixham, England, was married on Friday to Dr. Andrew Howard Jaffe, the son of Lynne and B. Edward Jaffe of Fort Lee, N.J. The couple, both astronomers at the University of California at Berkeley, were married by Freed Toor, a Universal Life minister, at the City Club in San Francisco.

Dr. Baker, 31, will keep her name. She is a Hubble Space Telescope Fellow in the Berkeley Astronomy Department, where she does research on quasars and clusters of galaxies. Dr. Jaffe, 34, works as an assistant research physicist in the same department, where he studies the history and evolution of the universe.

The bride graduated from and received a master's degree in physics from Cambridge University and received a Ph.D. in astrophysics from the University of Sydney in Australia.

Her father is a retired officer of the British Coast Guard. Her mother is a consultant and manager for Prosper, a business in Plymouth, England, that provides business training and management expertise to small local businesses.
The bridegroom graduated from Yale University and received a Ph.D. in astronomy and astrophysics from the University of Chicago. His father is a partner in Jaffe, Segal & Ross, a New York law firm.
